title: Firefox pwa
content:
Olá a todos

Att, Luis Davi
creator: LuisDavi

title: automatic way to remove old cache/history?
content: Hi, is there an addon or another way to automatically remove old browsing history based on some type of age limit? My storage area is about 1.5Gb and when I manually removed anything older than the last 3 months it dropped down in size considerably. I've seen a few addons that do the opposite, you can delete from newest up to older cache/history, but I would like something that keeps the last 3 months and gets rid of anything older.
creator: markandlyndon

title: Firefox is NOT! saving the history. Want to DISABLE "delete/clear history"
content: Firefox is NOT! saving the history. Want to DISABLE "delete/clear history" When it does save it, it does NOT save it for longer than 7 days. All settings are correct for saving 999days.
creator: billsktt

title: Widevine CDM crashing notifiation HELP

creator: hldufek

title: need to recover bookmarks WITHOUT using Mozilla standard proceedures - had catastrophy
content:
My 11y/o Win7 Pro x64 based water cooled monster finally failed taking the Intel DX79si m/b, the PNY Nvidea GTX980 and 2 of the 8 - 8gb mem sticks with it. The 16TB and 8TB add-in raid cards survived thank god. Also salvaged was the 250GB Samsung EVO SSD "C" drive. It was cloned to a duplicate the 1st day of every month. (No, it hasn't been overclocked in 8+ years, and even then I had the shut down temps set @ 50c). New m/b, processor, video card, memory, and unfortunately, Win10 Pro x64. All do in Friday. :-(. This old (76) man is gonna have to learn all over again:-( ( 'cept this time it's air-cooled and VERY conservative :-) )

My problem is the several hundred bookmarks I had in Firefox (I'm a LONGTIME user. I DON'T want to loose them. I've got the salvaged "C" drive SSD in a mini-dock (D:/ in the laptop) and I'm looking at them on my laptop (also Win7 Pro x64 based) ALL the files appear to be there at the time of the failure. I've already copied a bunch of the files from it so I'm not shut off completely. When I try to use the Mozilla feature to transfer them, it appears it want's to re-install & rewrite Firefox on the D:/ drive. NOT good. Isn't there a single (even multiple) file(s) that can be copied to C:\ so I can disconnect the mini-dock and THEN "import" them?

THANK YOU !!!!
creator: my61cat

title: I can't play videos on youtube when I'm signed into my account
content:
Firefox 78.10.1 esr 64 bit Windows 10.0.19041.985

This question was originally asked here, https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/971100 , but has since been archived. YouTube videos load when not logged in, but will not load when logged into my YouTube account. They produce the following error:

  • An error occurred. Please try again later. (Playback ID: [random generated hash])

The advice offered in the cited Mozilla Support article assumes the problem is with Firefox, and had users delete their entire SQL-Lite cookie database, even though users reported that the error persisted after a clean install. Yes, it can sometimes be a cookie database issue, but this time, MAY 2021, it's a problem with YouTube's ad loader. This has happened before [1]. The work around until they fix it is to click on any suggested video on the same page. As soon as it starts to load, hit the browser's back button, and the error producing video will load.

[1] https://support.google.com/youtube/thread/10329866/consistently-getting-an-error-occurred-please-try-again-later-playback-id-on-all-videos?hl=en
creator: eckman

title: Firefox Browser version 88.0.1 - Will no longer save open tabs when I close the browser.
content:
Firefox was acting normally keeping my open tabs when I open the browser this morning. I don't know what happened. I left the computer for a couple hours this afternoon. I opened Windows and found a "new desktop" which I didn't want. I clicked on it and it took me back to my normal desktop. I had left Firefox minimized. Maybe this is what has removed my settings in Firefox. Now when I open Firefox, my saved tabs are gone. I've tried twice putting them back in. I check Options to make sure that restore session is checked. Each time I close, I get a single tab and have to re-open all of my favorite pages all over again. My Windows 10 version is 20H2.

What can I do in options that will allow my open tabs to stay saved?

Please reply.
creator: Mitzee

title: Repositório de certificados do Windows
content: Olá a todos. Eu gosto muito do Firefox, mas no meu trabalho fica um pouco complicado o uso dele pois no minha estação de trabalho há vários certificados digitais instalados, o Firefox não utiliza o repositório do Windows, mas o seu próprio repositório, existe alguma extensão que permita o Firefox visualizar os certificados no repositório do Windows? Seria interessante para futuras versões a possibilidade do Firefox utilizar o repositório do Windows como padrão, pois só não uso o Firefox como padrão no meu trabalho por esse motivo.
creator: w.uill

title: 'New Tab Override' addon
content:
Firefox ver. 88.0.1 Os: Windows 10

'New Tab Override' addon

Since a small update on may the 19'th for this addon the option to 'focus on the webpage instead of the address bar' has disappeared. I can not find out why this option has disappeared ... Is it because of a combination the latest version of firefox and the May 19'th update of the addon? this option really was handy for me ... Now I keep typing my searches in the address bar by accident. could it be that the 'Zoom Page WE' which I set to 150% might be hiding the option? I reversed to the default 100% but still it did not avail the option. It seems to have disappeared. Maybe the developer forgot to put it in? Doe anyone have this same problem? Are there alternatives for a 'new tab' that set the focus on the webpage instead of the address bar?

Greetings MMori

SS001 Shows the current situation SS002 shows the former situation
creator: MrMori
